issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: create security group dialog, add another rule button remains disabled even though all rule fields contain data

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Created a rule that did not specify a source and the dialog let me do that. it should validate that all rule items are specified and properly formatted before sending the command to the CLC, and should notify me via red text on the dialog if something is missing or ill-formed.
fields.summary: security group dialogs do not validate for properly formed rules

comments.body: I just pushed some validation fixes.

The UI should validate format when focus leaves a field, or on typing. Currently I put in malformed IP and port and all I see are disabled buttons, no messages telling me what is malformed, so I don't know how to fix it.
it also allowed me to add my malformed rule (it's the one at the bottom), even though the button looked grayed out i could still click it. See screenshot.
I just submitted another fix to github
better, but the address range is telling me it is invalid and I haven't even entered anything yet. All I did was select my protocol and the message popped up. See attached screenshot.
validation on IP field still needs a bit of tweaking to be right.
This was fixed in a push today for another bug. Validation is now done on "change" not on "keyup"

current fix messes up button enablement code. Validating on focus change is fine for most fields, the problem is that some fields are the last ones a person enters data into before they hit the "go do this thing" button. that is why you have to validate on BOTH focus change AND button click, and leave the button enablement as it was, where it enables when every required field contains something

Jenny, could you please try on the current version of the sec group dialog? If there is a set of steps that cause a bad state, jot them down here so I can reproduce. The dialog does work differently than it used to due to the tabs.
[~dkavanagh]: Will do. I have back to back to back meetings today but will try and find a spare moment to check this out, and I'll let you know what I find here. Thanks!

button enablement seems OK but validaiton message is not clearing once I clear the offending field. In this case I tried 1.r.r.r and got a validation error (which is good) but once I deleted that text the validation error is still displaying. And I started entering text in the IP address field that should have been valid and that did not clear the message either.
please see last comment for what is missing here.
Add the fix to clear off the validation error message when the IP input box gets empty in the security group dialog.

Validation is now completely broken on create security group and manage rules. Additionally, the CSS on create security group is now broken so that a gray box appears when I mouse over the "use my IP address" link and the text goes black when i mouse over "add another rule" button. See attached screenshots. I also included a screenshot of manage rules dialog where validation is broken but css still seems OK. WTF.

Jenny,

I am not aware of what the proper CSS behavior should be like for the manage security rules dialog. It'd help if you could provide more information on the CSS issue. Or, it'd be better if a separate ticket can be created for this issue since it's a CSS related, not validation.

And for the validation, the current mechanism is set in a such way that the validation of the input takes place after the input is fully specified, on "key down."

I can take a look at the code to see if we could perform the validation as input being typed in.

The validation and CSS were working before this fix. All that was broken was the validation message wasn't clearing when the field was cleared. Now the other things are broken. To me that does not warrant a separate bug being filed, It means this bug was not fixed correctly. [~neil], thoughts?

As seen in the commit detail above, (https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/0a3dcf7eeddfbbe626fc56e60e8f4a44740fed73)

the only fix that I made was a single line:

dialog.find('#allow-ip-error').text("");

, which is to remove the error message when the input box for the ip is empty.

It's unclear how that would cause those CSS issues, but will double-check.
OK, thanks, pop in to IRC if you need anything, I am sure other devs can help. [~jpommer] has fixed this issue before on other dialogs so he can probably help.
I just removed the single line fix from the latest code, and still seeing the same CSS issues. It must be that some rules for the button and span classes have changed.
I agree. That single line javascript change would not have caused the CSS weirdness. I'd open another bug for that, [~jloza]

Perhaps it was the original code change that added the validation to create security group? Manage rules seems to have no validation. [~dkavanagh] can you verify you originally fixed the validation problem on both dialogs, and that both are calling the same classes, since the CSS looks OK on the manage rules dialog but not on create security group?

I'm seeing that validation on the IP looks good to me. If I type something odd, it gives a message. It removes the message only when I have a valid entry (and I don't have to change focus to see that). On the "create" dialog, there is an odd rollover feature on the "use my IP" link. This isn't there on the "manage rules" dialog.
On Manage Rules, I was seeing an odd validation thing where I have an error in the port range, the "save" button is enabled, but doesn't function if clicked. If I put a valid range in, I can click "save". I would have liked to see the validation error at minimum.

I pulled from team just now and i am not seeing any of the rules fields get any validation errors displaying whatsoever on create scaling group. Also the classes for manage IP on rollover and the add another rule button are not correct. Attaching screenshot showing two invalid form fields with no messages displayed for either one. 

On Manage rules dialog validation is happening on IP field when focus leaves the field, but no validation is happening on the port field (unless 22-hhhhhiudadsglj is a valid port range?). Validation message does clear correctly on manage rules dialog when the offending text entry field contents are cleared, and also CSS classes look correct on manage rules for the use my IP link and the add another rule button.

I'm looking at the code. There are 2 methods that are being attached to events. "validateForm" and "validateFormNoWarn". Specifically, for the ports, there is a keyup listener that calls "validateFormNoWarn" and there is a change listener that calls "validateForm"
What this does is to control create button enablement as the user types, but only give them a warning as they exit the field. I've seen this work. I type "22-ee" and tab to the next field and get a warning.
I think this was done so that users don't see warnings "as they type" which I think you did not want.
I pushed a fix to manage because the template was missing the port error div. You should see those errors now. Update and restart your proxy.
validation *SHOULD* be occurring as user types, not the other way around. Still not seeing any validation errors when I type 1.r.r.r as IP address

Please try the attach volume dialog from the instance landing page. That does validate as you type a volume ID. It shows an error on the first character. When we did 3.2 (and the original security group dialog), you didn't like that. I want to confirm the change in strategy here before changing the code.

Hey [~dkavanagh], I think you misunderstood the thing I didn't like. I like live validation, what I don't like is getting a validation error before I have done anything wrong. In this case, I type "v" and the list drops down as it should. I haven't entered anything invalid yet so it should not be showing me a validation error. 

Does that make sense to you now? It shouldn't show an error until there actually is one. Let me know if you have any more questions, it might be easier just to call me and we can talk it out.
please switch out to on-submit validation.

[~jloza], This one appears to have been fixed already. It activates the button when the IP address field is non-empty, and validates it on submit, showing an error if the IP address is malformed. Looks like it's doing what it should... can you have another quick look and point out what is missing, if anything?
looks like it has been fixed already. Yay!
